thread.title: The Best Strap-Happy Briefcases

author: Jacob Gallagher
title: The Best Strap-Happy Briefcases
text:
0 COMMENTS ENLARGE Clockwise from top left: Alligator Commuter Bag, $22,000, Ralph Lauren, 888-475-7674; Renzo Leather Briefcase, $1,095, ernestalexander.com; Leather Briefcase, $795, jwhulmeco.com; Leather Bag, $3,850, Berluti, 212-439-6400; Morris Briefcase, $950, mismo.dk Photo: F. Martin Ramin/The Wall Street Journal, Styling by Anne Cardenas “DOORS CLOSING PLEASE.” Like a pistol’s blast at a track meet, those three words are enough to turn your morning commute into a fifty-yard dash. And you’re off, weaving through fellow strap-hangers to squeeze through the train doors a split second before they close. Phew, you made it. But your relief morphs into panic as you realize that you abandoned your briefcase back on the platform bench.
Though beautiful, the high-end, top-handle briefcase isn’t necessarily built for the rigors of the rat race. But more luxe brands are adding a longer strap to their cases, allowing them to be slung over your shoulder or across your body. In their small way, they’re a game-changer. And if you’re wondering whether a man carrying Ralph Lauren’s sumptuous croc zip-top would take the subway, consider this: the biggest luxury today is time, something you can save when you opt for the express train over your driver and the city’s traffic jams.
